Vineyard update: We headed up to the top of Quaker Run Vineyard to check in on the vines. ‚Å†‚Å†
‚Å†‚Å†
At this stage in the growing season, there‚Äôs a lot of attention and handwork focused on the canopy to best ensure fully ripe, healthy grapes come harvest. ‚Å†‚Å†
‚Å†‚Å†
First, our vineyard crew removed leaves from the fruiting zone - this allows dappled sunlight to reach the bunches and keep them open to the breezes and free of disease. The shoots have quickly reached the top of the trellising wires and we‚Äôll be hedging to prevent shading and focus ripening energy towards grapes, not leaves. For the cover crops and growth between the vines, we gently crimp to encourage the buildup of organic material in the soils. Now it‚Äôs countdown to veraison, when the grapes will change from bright green to either red or golden as they gather sugars and head towards harvest. ‚Å†‚Å†

The Early Mountain 2020 Five Forks is ready to star in your summer festivities.‚Å†
‚Å†
2020 finds a way to embrace the textural nature of Petit Manseng while maintaining the freshness of the Sauvignon blanc. The perfect summer wine!‚Å†

We approach this Chardonnay with an eye on freshness, precision and texture. Barrel fermented and aged, with primarily older French oak - and a bit of new  northern European oak, coopered in Austria. It was bottled in June having finished malolactic fermentation; a technique we are able to employ for texture and mouthfeel, as we modify our farming approach to favor acidity and freshness. The result is a wine with the roundness and flavors of aging in barrel, on the lees, but also one that retains freshness and the energy of the vintage.‚Å†
